definition: the production of goods, especially those made in factories. The part of industry that involves the production of steel, coal, or large goods such as aircraft is called heavy industry. The part of industry that involves the production of small goods, for example electronic equipment, is called light industry
the people and organizations involved in producing goods
belonging to or connected with industry
a particular industry, trade, or service and the people who work in it
an activity or business that has become very successful, especially one that you think makes an unfair profit or is not necessary
hard work and effort
